intro: Chiococca phaenostemon, commonly known as the pink-flowered chiococca, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Chiococca phaenostemon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and humid valleys.
